image.altText: Artist impression of AFL match underway at proposed Macquarie Point stadium

props.synopsis: A group of Tasmanian politicians opposed to the proposed Hobart stadium has failed to convince the AFL to abandon the contentious project during a meeting in Melbourne.

title.children: 'No stadium, no team': AFL refuses to budge on Hobart project

image.altText: People gathered around the LEGO City.

props.synopsis: An 80 per cent dropout rate, compliance concerns, and a LEGO city sold as a "highlight" â€” this multimillion-dollar cybersecurity initiative has been labelled a "patch job".

title.children: 'A show pony': New cybersecurity course had 80pc dropout rate

image.altText: Bridge safety barrier design concept art.

props.synopsis: Plans to widen the pedestrian and cycling pathways on Hobart's Tasman Bridge were scrapped last year, but improved safety barriers and passing bays will go ahead.

title.children: Upgraded Tasman Bridge barrier designs released, after coroner found 'immediate need'

image.altText: A man with short grey hair addresses media while wearing a blue suit and standing in the bridge of a ferry.

props.synopsis: Ken Kanofski responds to the expensive specification error concerning fenders at the Devonport wharf, and answers questions about the current finances of TT-Line.

title.children: 'I'm not happy but I don't have a choice': TT-Line chair explains $9 million fender bungle

image.altText: A bulldozer moves black material at a processing facility surrounded by conveyors, large buildings, and chimneys.

props.synopsis: As a pause in production at troubled smelter Liberty Bell Bay stretches on, speculation about its future builds after a series of meetings between a US private credit provider and Tasmania's industry minister.

title.children: Liberty Bell Bay future in spotlight as speculation over takeover bid builds

image.altText: A close-up of a locked gate inside a prison.

props.synopsis: A female Aboriginal prisoner has died in custody after a "serious medical episode", Tasmania's director of prisons has confirmed.

title.children: Female Aboriginal prisoner dies in custody in Tasmania

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The operator of Tasmania's ferry fleet told the state-owned operator of ports, "They're our ships, we know what we're doing", before botching design specifications, an inquiry has heard.

title.children: 'We know what we're doing': Ferry operator doubled down before $9m blunder

image.altText: People walking through a washed out street in a town.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 77 per cent of the country is without power after the category five "storm of the century" barrelled through on Tuesday.

title.children: 'That was hell': Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of devastation in Jamaica

image.altText: Yasmine Phillips and Chris Robinson with daughters Sage (centre) and Ava.

props.synopsis: A program introduced in Australia in 2018 has led to thousands of fewer babies born early each year, according to a new study.

title.children: A study of 2 million Australian births led doctors to world-first discovery

image.altText: Mr Butler speaks in front of a beige wall.

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mark Butler says attempts by Coalition MPs to conflate new laws ensuring women who suffer a stillbirth retain access to maternity leave with late-term abortions are "deeply distressing".

title.children: Minister condemns Coalition MPs for 'distressing' comments on stillbirth leave law â€” as it happened

image.altText: Peter Cowell in admiral whites and cap.

props.synopsis: Peter Cowell's whereabouts have been unknown since July 2024, but the ABC has tracked him down to suburban Perth.

title.children: Fake admiral peddling 'bogus' scheme found a year after vanishing

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints

image.altText: A woman wearing a suit smiles and waves.

props.synopsis: Former US vice-president Kamala Harris reveals she is contemplating another run for the presidency and says she was "reckless" to not stop Joe Biden from pursuing a second term.

title.children: 'Knew what he would do': Harris speaks out on Trump's America

image.altText: White cruise ship on water with island in background.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority will speak with the crew of a cruise ship that allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman, who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

title.children: 'Knew she was dead': Tourists distressed after cruise passenger's body found

image.altText: A grainy, monochrome image of two boats close together on the ocean.

props.synopsis: Mexican authorities are searching for a lone survivor seen clinging to wreckage following the strikes in the eastern Pacific Ocean.

title.children: 14 people killed as US destroys four more alleged drug boats

image.altText: A car with open doors, a russian flag, all on a lawn with police nearby.

props.synopsis: Confronting body-worn footage showing the incident was played in court during the sentencing of 40-year-old Rimi Abraham.

title.children: Man jailed for ramming car through gates of Russian consulate in Sydney

image.altText: Musician Lily Allen struggles with bags of groceries at the front door of a residence

props.synopsis: Lily Allen has dropped her first album in seven years and it is... revealing. We asked Australian artists about turning pain into power, and why break-up songs resonate so deeply with fans.Â

title.children: Aussie artists on what it's like to share a break-up with the world

image.altText: John Cleese at a kitchen bench next to Prunella Scales during a scene in Fawlty Towers.

props.synopsis: Prunella Scales has been remembered as part of the golden era of British comedy for her numerous roles across film, TV and theatre. Â

title.children: John Cleese leads tributes to 'perfect' on-screen wife Prunella Scales

image.altText: Police in a dam.

props.synopsis: Police divers, cadaver dogs and SES have been searching a property at Cressbrook Creek, north of Toowoomba, as they investigate the alleged murder of Paul Woods.

title.children: Police find suspected human remains during search of rural property

image.altText: An exterior of a Canberra school.

props.synopsis: The man is warned that he came close to being remanded in custody, with the magistrate saying he is on a "knife-edge".

title.children: Canberra father allegedly threatens daughter and friends with axe outside school

image.altText: Illustration of car and home with rooftop solar.

props.synopsis: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles are sweeping the Australian market. Exclusive modelling suggests the "low-emission" sales boom may actually delay emissions reductions.

title.children: Users say they plug in their hybrid EVs, but the data says otherwise

image.altText: A Virgin plan on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: A man who drove through the airport's perimeter fence three times in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Man jailed over theft of Virgin van driven on Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Melbourne's Easey Street murder case tell a court that DNA found at the crime scene is highly likely to have come from prime suspect Perry Kouroumblis.

title.children: DNA from 1977 murder scene likely came from prime suspect, court hears

image.altText: Flowers on a gate a showgrounds with police standing in the background.

props.synopsis: A former police officer has been killed in a hit and run while walking her dogs in Ulmarra on the New South Wales north coast. Â

title.children: Police search for evidence after hit and run kills former cop

image.altText: A middle aged white man with white hair looking in the mirror, folding his lips back to reveal broken teeth

props.synopsis: A 12-fold increase in Australians raiding their retirement nest eggs to fund expensive dental treatments in recent years has been labelled a "systemic failure".

title.children: Jon has been left with metal posts instead of teeth and $40k less super

image.altText: Man looking sad at doorway

props.synopsis: More than 100 residents face an uncertain future after a Queensland council votes to end permanent residencies at a holiday park.

title.children: Dozens of homes now 'worthless' after council's van park decision

image.altText: The Malaysian prime minister sitting in a chair smiling.

props.synopsis: The South-East Asian nation has been in the spotlight this week after hosting the ASEAN summit, which was attended by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Things have changed': Malaysia's PM on navigating Trump's tariffs

image.altText: Mark Latham wearing a suit speaking to media on the street outside court.

props.synopsis: An apprehended violence order application against MP Mark Latham is "very much likely" to be resolved but remains ongoing, his former partner's lawyer has told a court.

title.children: 'Likely to settle': Update in AVO matter filed by Latham's ex-partner

image.altText: Sam Kerr rubs her forehead with her left hand in frustration

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr's coach and teammates aren't second-guessing the decision to re-install her as Matildas captain after returning to the field following a lengthy lay-off.

title.children: Matildas launch fierce defence of Sam Kerr amid criticism of captaincy call

image.altText: Three older people sit in a boat in flooded water.

props.synopsis: Heavy rains cause major flooding in central Vietnam, while a category five hurricane rages on the other side of the world in the Caribbean.

title.children: Vietnam tourist hotspots flooded after record rainfall

image.altText: David Fifita looks upwards while playing for the Titans

props.synopsis: After flirting with exits from the Titans previously, David Fifita makes his move official, joining the South Sydney Rabbitohs on a deal for the next two seasons.

title.children: Fifita makes Bennett reunion official by joining Rabbitohs after Titans exit

image.altText: A street sign that reads 'Slag Street'.

props.synopsis:
Broken Hill resident Sid Siddall worries a lack of signage could result in emergency services being unable to find him the next time he needs urgent help.

Â

title.children: Slag Street resident pleads for people to stop stealing his sign

image.altText: An umpire throws the ball in

props.synopsis: The AFL confirms the arrival of the last disposal rule as one of seven rule changes aimed at making umpires' jobs easier while shortening the length of games.

title.children: Last disposal rule headlines AFL's seven changes for 2026 season

image.altText: The recently constructed Kurilpa Building on the Brisbane State High campus

props.synopsis: The state's education minister has ordered an investigation into the blunder, which was initially believed to affect one school, before that number grew.

title.children: At least eight Queensland state high schools taught wrong topic for year 12 exam
